intro: Deyeuxia imbricata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sedges, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils, often found in meadows, wetlands, and along streambanks. The plant has slender, triangular stems with linear, grass-like leaves that are usually dark green in color. Its small, spike-like inflorescences contain numerous tiny flowers, which are wind-pollinated. Deyeuxia imbricata plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
